page.title: 01General description of area
page.content:
The area is governed locally by {Carrick District Council,{Truro City {Council}and{Cornwall County Council. There are also Parish Councils involved in its administration, namely Kenwyn and St.Clement.
South of the block fringes on to the northern part of the cathedral city of {Truro.}In the N.W.there is the village of{Shortlanesend.
The land is drained by two rivers, from the north the{River Allen}and the west by the{River Kenwyn.}The two rivers meet to the south forming the {Truro River,}which is tidal. Eventually it flows into the River Fal. The land is covered mainly by farmland, mostly grazing although some fields are cultivated to the growing of barley.
